courseDesc: Kakamega is a town in western Kenya lying about 30 km north of the Equator. It is the headquarters of Kakamega County that has a population of 1,867,579 (2019 census)
It is a rock formation about 40 m high, with a small rock perched on top. There is a stream of water which flows between the two rocks, creating an impression of a crying stone.
It is Kenyaâ€™s only tropical rainforest and the last remnant of the ancient Guineo-congolian rainforest that once stretched all across the continent.
It is a gold mining site located off the Kakamega-Mumias Road. You can visit the site to have a glimpse of the local gold mining industry.
Located along Kisumu-Kakamega road, this market operates every day but is usually busiest on Saturdays and Wednesday Mornings.
It is located along the Kakamega-Kisumu highway. It is one of the biggest pottery-making centres in western Kenya.

An event and sporting facility located in Kakamega town. It is a multipurpose stadium where you can visit to watch local football matches and cultural events. The stadium has a capacity of 5,000 people.
It is a retreat and events centre that features swimming pools, well-manicured lawns, luxury guest rooms and a modern restaurant.
